headline.main: On Campuses, Seeing the Military With New Eyes; After Sept. 11 Attack, Students Reconsider Old Perceptions

lead_paragraph: At Seton Hall University, some students who previously ignored the R.O.T.C. cadets roaming around campus now regard their uniformed classmates as -- of all things -- cool. Some have been so inspired that they say they may join the military, too. At Bronx Community College, where military service has always been an attractive avenue to win a scholarship, some students who had previously thought of joining the military now say they won't. They are too scared.
abstract: Attacks of Sept 11 have altered how college students in New York area perceive military, prospect of service and their peers who decide to join; ROTC cadets, previously ignored on many campuses, are now viewed with new cachet and are inspiring others to join; photo (M)
